intro: Icica sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower icica, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellow in color. The plant has a compact growth habit with thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its dry habitat. It produces seeds in small, dry capsules that are dispersed by wind. Icica sessiliflora is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
